== Galaxy Nexus ==
== Galaxy Nexus ==
  +
[[File:Galaxy Nexus.png|100px|thumb|[[Galaxy Nexus]]]]
{{main|Galaxy Nexus}}
{{main|Galaxy Nexus}}
The Galaxy Nexus is a [[SIM lock|SIM-unlocked]]<ref>http://www.amazon.co.uk/Samsung-I9250-Galaxy-Nexus-Mobile/dp/B005XYU45E</ref><ref>http://www.expansys-usa.com/google-nexus-prime-android-smartphone-unlocked-16gb-224148/</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slashgear.com/galaxy-nexus-gets-priced-sim-free-19189361/ |title=Galaxy Nexus gets priced SIM-free |publisher=SlashGear |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref> and hardware-unlocked<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/24/motorola-razr-open-for-unlocked-bootloader-business-if-the-carr/ |title=Motorola RAZR open for unlocked bootloader business, if the carrier says so |publisher=Engadget |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.handtec.co.uk/product.php/5527/samsung-galaxy-nexus-16gb--sim-free-unlocked- |title=Buy Samsung Galaxy Nexus 16GB (SIM Free/Unlocked) Reviews |publisher=Handtec.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Mills |first=Adam |url=http://www.gottabemobile.com/2011/10/14/can-the-motorola-droid-razr-compete-with-the-galaxy-nexus/ |title=Can the Motorola Droid RAZR Compete with the Galaxy Nexus? |publisher=Gottabemobile.com |date=2011-10-14 |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Mills |first=Adam |url=http://www.gottabemobile.com/2011/10/18/motorola-droid-razr-shipping-with-locked-bootloader/ |title=Motorola Droid RAZR Shipping with Locked Bootloader |publisher=Gottabemobile.com |date=2011-10-18 |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref> device that is designed for advanced developers. The device ships with a system image that is fully compatible with Android 4.0. It is possible to use any [[Subscriber Identity Module|SIM]] in the device and one can flash custom Android builds that will work with the [[bootloader]].
The Galaxy Nexus is a [[SIM lock|SIM-unlocked]]<ref>http://www.amazon.co.uk/Samsung-I9250-Galaxy-Nexus-Mobile/dp/B005XYU45E</ref><ref>http://www.expansys-usa.com/google-nexus-prime-android-smartphone-unlocked-16gb-224148/</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slashgear.com/galaxy-nexus-gets-priced-sim-free-19189361/ |title=Galaxy Nexus gets priced SIM-free |publisher=SlashGear |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref> and hardware-unlocked<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/24/motorola-razr-open-for-unlocked-bootloader-business-if-the-carr/ |title=Motorola RAZR open for unlocked bootloader business, if the carrier says so |publisher=Engadget |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.handtec.co.uk/product.php/5527/samsung-galaxy-nexus-16gb--sim-free-unlocked- |title=Buy Samsung Galaxy Nexus 16GB (SIM Free/Unlocked) Reviews |publisher=Handtec.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Mills |first=Adam |url=http://www.gottabemobile.com/2011/10/14/can-the-motorola-droid-razr-compete-with-the-galaxy-nexus/ |title=Can the Motorola Droid RAZR Compete with the Galaxy Nexus? |publisher=Gottabemobile.com |date=2011-10-14 |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Mills |first=Adam |url=http://www.gottabemobile.com/2011/10/18/motorola-droid-razr-shipping-with-locked-bootloader/ |title=Motorola Droid RAZR Shipping with Locked Bootloader |publisher=Gottabemobile.com |date=2011-10-18 |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref> device that is designed for advanced developers. The device ships with a system image that is fully compatible with Android 4.0. It is possible to use any [[Subscriber Identity Module|SIM]] in the device and one can flash custom Android builds that will work with the [[bootloader]].
